personality.text: I take initiative to coordinate tasks when my team seems unclear about next steps.
When faced with multiple project setbacks, I stay motivated and keep working toward the goal.
I enjoy brainstorming unconventional solutions, even if some ideas seem risky at first.
I am honest about mistakes I make at work, even if it might affect my evaluation.
When given incomplete information, I can still make a reasonable choice without overthinking.
I actively seek input from quieter team members to ensure everyone’s ideas are considered.
When a project’s priority suddenly changes, I can quickly re-plan my tasks and keep pace.

values_motivation.text: I break down complex problems into smaller, manageable parts before deciding what to do.
I prefer to collect and analyze relevant data before taking action, even if it takes more time.
I can make decisions quickly when required, without overanalyzing minor details.
When faced with a challenge, I actively think of creative solutions instead of sticking to old methods.
I am comfortable taking calculated risks when the potential reward justifies it.
After making a poor decision, I reflect on what went wrong to avoid repeating it.
I value team brainstorming sessions when solving tough issues.

career_adaptability.text: I often inspire others by sharing a clear picture of what success will look like.
I trust team members to take ownership of tasks instead of micromanaging.
I am driven more by personal satisfaction and learning than by external rewards.
I seek input from others before making important team decisions.
I make it a point to celebrate my team’s achievements publicly.
Setting ambitious goals keeps me focused and energized at work.
I enjoy guiding others to develop their skills and confidence.

cognitive_simulator.text: You notice two team members not participating actively. How do you handle this?
options: Ask privately if they need support

cognitive_simulator.text: Your professor says your solution is correct but overly complex. What should you do?
options: Wait to be asked to revise

cognitive_simulator.text: Your mentor assigns you a task outside your comfort zone. How do you respond?
options: Attempt it and ask help when stuck
cognitive_simulator.correct: Attempt it and ask help when stuck

cognitive_simulator.text: Your group project is behind schedule, team is demotivated. What do you do?
